      • NUM_TIMERS_ENABLED_ADDR

        public static final org.marssa.footprint.datatypes.integer.MInteger NUM_TIMERS_ENABLED_ADDR
        The register containing the number of timers enabled. For the LabJack U3 this can be a value between 0 and 2
        See Also:
        http://labjack.com/support/u3/users-guide/2.9

      • TIMER_BASE_CLOCK_ADDR

        public static final org.marssa.footprint.datatypes.integer.MInteger TIMER_BASE_CLOCK_ADDR

        See Also:

      • setTimerMode

        public void setTimerMode(ITimer timer,
                ITimerConfigMode timerConfigMode)
                  throws org.marssa.footprint.exceptions.ConfigurationError,
                         org.marssa.footprint.exceptions.NoConnection
        Sets the timer mode The number of timers enabled is set from the constructor. Since this is variable, the timer selected here may not be available. In this case the constructor will fail and raise an exception.
        Parameters:
        timer - the timer which will be configured
        timerConfigMode - the mode for the specified timer
        Throws:
        org.marssa.footprint.exceptions.ConfigurationError
        org.marssa.footprint.exceptions.NoConnection
        See Also:
        LabJackU3.TimersEnabledU3, LabJackUE9.TimersEnabledUE9, http://labjack.com/support/u3/users-guide/2.9, http://labjack.com/support/ue9/users-guide/2.10

      • setTimerBaseClock

        public void setTimerBaseClock(ITimerBaseClock timerBaseClock)
                       throws org.marssa.footprint.exceptions.NoConnection
        Sets the base clock for the LabJack timers
        Parameters:
        timerBaseClock - the base clock for the LabJack timers
        Throws:
        org.marssa.footprint.exceptions.NoConnection
        See Also:
        LabJackU3.TimerBaseClockU3, LabJackUE9.TimerBaseClockUE9, org.marssa.services.diagnostics.daq.LabJack.TIMER_BASE_CLOCK_ADDR

      • getTimerBaseClock

        public ITimerBaseClock getTimerBaseClock()

      • setTimerValue

        public void setTimerValue(ITimer timer,
                 org.marssa.footprint.datatypes.integer.MInteger timerValue)
                   throws org.marssa.footprint.exceptions.NoConnection,
                          org.marssa.footprint.exceptions.OutOfRange,
                          org.marssa.footprint.exceptions.ConfigurationError
        Sets the value of the given timer. The number of timers enabled is set from the constructor. Since this is variable, the timer selected here may not be available.
        Note: 0 means duty cycle = 100% and 65535 means duty cycle = 0%
        Parameters:
        timer - the timer which will be configured
        timerValue - the value for the given timer
        Throws:
        org.marssa.footprint.exceptions.ConfigurationError
        org.marssa.footprint.exceptions.OutOfRange
        org.marssa.footprint.exceptions.NoConnection
        See Also:
        org.marssa.services.diagnostics.daq.LabJack.TimersEnabled

      • setTimerClockDivisor

        public void setTimerClockDivisor(org.marssa.footprint.datatypes.integer.MInteger timerClockDivisor)
                          throws org.marssa.footprint.exceptions.OutOfRange,
                                 org.marssa.footprint.exceptions.NoConnection
        Sets the base clock for the LabJack timers
        Note: The timer clock divisor value must be between 1 and 256, otherwise an OutOfRange will be thrown!
        Parameters:
        timerBaseClock - the base clock for the LabJack timers
        Throws:
        org.marssa.footprint.exceptions.OutOfRange
        org.marssa.footprint.exceptions.ConfigurationError
        org.marssa.footprint.exceptions.NoConnection
        See Also:
        LabJackU3.TimerBaseClockU3, LabJackUE9.TimerBaseClockUE9, org.marssa.services.diagnostics.daq.LabJack.TIMER_CLOCK_DIVISOR_ADDR

      • getTimerClockDivisor

        public org.marssa.footprint.datatypes.integer.MInteger getTimerClockDivisor()

      • write

        public void write(org.marssa.footprint.datatypes.integer.MInteger registerNumber,
         org.marssa.footprint.datatypes.integer.MInteger registerValue)
           throws org.marssa.footprint.exceptions.NoConnection
        This write method is used to write to registers RegisterNumber is the register to write to while the registerValue is the value to write in the register(1 is used for logic high while 0 is used for logic low)
        Throws:
        org.marssa.footprint.exceptions.NoConnection

      • write

        public void write(org.marssa.footprint.datatypes.integer.MInteger registerNumber,
         org.marssa.footprint.datatypes.MBoolean state)
           throws org.marssa.footprint.exceptions.NoConnection
        A modification of the write method to accept boolean as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        registerNumber - The register number for the port which will take the new state
        state - The state of the output port (true = high, false = low)
        Throws:
        org.marssa.footprint.exceptions.NoConnection

      • writeMultiple

        public void writeMultiple(org.marssa.footprint.datatypes.integer.MInteger registerNumber,
                 org.marssa.footprint.datatypes.integer.MInteger registerValue)
                   throws org.marssa.footprint.exceptions.NoConnection
        Throws:
        org.marssa.footprint.exceptions.NoConnection

      • read

        public org.marssa.footprint.datatypes.decimal.MDecimal read(org.marssa.footprint.datatypes.integer.MInteger ref,
                                                   org.marssa.footprint.datatypes.integer.MInteger count,
                                                   org.marssa.footprint.datatypes.integer.MInteger AIN)
                                                     throws org.marssa.footprint.exceptions.NoConnection,
                                                            IOException
        this method is used to read from a register/port. The ref and count MIntegers are to select the registers that are going to be read. The AIN is the value which is going to be read
        Throws:
        org.marssa.footprint.exceptions.NoConnection
        IOException
